gurmukhi: niRp ByjXo AkRUr khu hir mwrn ky Gwq ] Ab bD kysI kI kQw BeI kho soeI bwq ]776]
transliteration: Nrip Bhejyo Akroor Kauh Har(i) Maaran Ke Ghaat|| Ab Badh Kesikikathaa Bhaikaho Soibaat||776||
translation: Kansa sent Akrur for waiting in ambush for the killing of Krishna; now with this I relate the story of the killing of Keshi.776.

gurmukhi: pRwq clXo qh ko auT so irp hÍY hX dIrG pY qh AwXo ] dyKq jwih idnyS frXo mGvw ijh pyKq hI frpwXo ]
transliteration: Praat Chadyo Tah Ko Outh So Rip Hvai Haya Deeragh Pai Tah Aayo|| Dekhat Jaah(i) Dinesh Daryo Maghvaa Jih Pekhat Hidarpaayo||
translation: Keshi started early in the morning and assuming the form of a big horse, he reached Braja; seeing him the sun and Indra were filled with fear;

gurmukhi: gÍwr fry iqh dyKq hI hir pwien aUpr sIs JukwXo ] DIr BXo jdurwie qbY iqh ko kup kY rn duMd mcwXo ]777]
transliteration: Gvaar Dare Tih Dekhat Hihar(i) Paain Oopar Sees Jhoukaayo|| Dheer Bhayo Jaduraae Tabai Tih Ko Koup Kai Ran Dound Machadyo||777||
translation: The frightened gopas seeing him also bowed their heads at the feet of Krishna; seeing all this, Krishna became resolute with composure and on this side Keshi started a dreadful fighting.777.

gurmukhi: kop BXo irp ky mn mY qb pwau kI kwnH ko cot clweI ] dIn n lwgn sXwm qnY su BlI ibiD so jdurwie bcweI ]
transliteration: Kop Bhayo Rip Ke Man Mai Tab Paau Kikaahn Ko Chot Chadhaaee|| Deen Na Laagad Syaam Tanai Su Bhalibidh(i) So Jaduraae Bachaaee||
translation: The enemy Keshi, in rage, attacked Krishna with his feet, but Krishna did not let him touch his body and saved himself nicely;

gurmukhi: Pyr ghXo soaU pwien qy kr mo n rhXo su dXo hY bgweI ] ijau lrkw bt PYNkq hY iqm cwr sY pYg prXo soaU jweI ]778]
transliteration: Pher Gadyo Sooo Paain Te Kar Mo Na Rahyo Su Dayo Hai Bagadee|| Jio Larkaa Bat Phainkat Hai Tim Chaar Sai Paig Daryo Sooo Jaaee||778||
translation: Then Krishna caught hold of the feet of Keshi and raising him threw him at a distance, just as the boys throw the wooden stick; Kehsi fell down at a distance of four hundred steps.778.

gurmukhi: Pyr sMBwr qbY bl vwir pquMf pswir hir aUpir DwXo ] locn kwF bfy frvwn ikDO ijn qY nB lok frwXo ]
transliteration: Pher Sanbhaar Tahai Bal Daar(i) Patound Padaar(i) Har(i) Oopar(i) Dhaayo|| Lochanndkaadh Bade Darvaan Kidhau Jin Tai Nabh Lok Daraayo||
translation: Again stabilising himself and spreading his mouth Keshi fell upon Krishna; being used to frighten the heavenly beings, he opened his eyes wide and began to terrorise;

gurmukhi: sXwm dXo iqhky muK mY kir qw Cib ko mn mY jsu BwXo ] kwnH ko hÍYkr kwl mno qn kysI qy pRwn inkwsn AwXo ]779]
transliteration: Syaam Dayo Tih-ke Moukh Mai Kar(i) Taa Chhab(i) Ko Man Mai Jas(u) Bhaayo|| Kaahn Ko Hvaikar Kaal Mano Tan Kesite Praan Nikaasan Aayo||779||
translation: Krishna put his hand in his mouth and it seemed that Krishna, assuming the form of death, was electing the life-force from the body of Keshi.779.

gurmukhi: iqn bwh ktI hir dwNqn so iqh ky sB dwNq qbY Jrgy ] joaU Awie mnorQ kY mn mY sm Ern kI soaU hY grgy ]
transliteration: Tin Baah Katihar(i) Daantan So Tih Ke Sabh Daant Tabai Jharge|| Jooo Aae Manorath Kai Man Mai Sam Oran Kisooo Hai Gadge||
translation: He (Keshi) tried to penetrate his teeth in the arm of Krishna, but his teeth fell off; the object for which he had come, was defeated;

gurmukhi: qb hI soaU jUJ pro iCq pY n soaU iPrkY Apny Grgy ] Ab kwnHr ky kir lwgq hI mir gXo vh pwp sBY hrgy ]780]
transliteration: Tah Hisooo Joojh Daro Chhit Pai Na Sooo Phirkai Apne Gharge|| Ah Kaahnar Ke Kar(i) Laagad Himar(i) Gyo Vah Paap Sabhai Harge||780||
translation: He could not go back to his house and while fighting fell down on the earth; he died at the hands of Krishna and all his sins were destroyed.780.

gurmukhi: rwvn jw ibiD rwm mrXo ibiD jo krkY nrkwsur mwrXo ] ijau pHlwd k r`Cn ko hrnwkS mwir frXo n aubwrXo ]
transliteration: Raavan Jaa Bidh(i) Raam Daryo Bidh(i) Jo Karkai Narkaasur Mdaryo|| Jio Prahlaad Ke Rachchhan Ko Harnaakash Daar(i) Daryo Na Oubdaryo||
translation: The method by which Ram killed Ravana and the method with which narakasura died, the method with which Hiranyakashipu was killed by the Lord for the protection of Prahlad;
